poem:
Title: Hunger, the Inanimate Warfare

The wheelbarrow rotting,
beside the silent, pale children,
Gaza's outcry.

Concrete structures, cloaked in sorrow,
Quiver beneath the desolate belly,
Of famine that Israel sows,

Crumbs are dreams,
War, an indifferent windsweeper.
Oh Borrell, your statement echoes,

Vast, the garden of plenty,
Shrinks to a teardrop's grave,
In Gaza, we are no longer on the brink of starvation,

We are swallowed whole.
